728762f-b.text:
1191 Clove Road, adjoining the S.E. corner of Beverly Avenue, showing a colonial house. The house is located 150 feet south of the site of the old Corsen House and was owned by Mrs. M. Vreuenbrugh in 1874 (Beers's map). It later became the property of J. M. Vanderbilt.
1924
P. L. Sperr
(2)
A view of the house, eight years later, seen
from Beverly Avenue.
May 16, 1932
P. L. Sperr
728762f-b.folder: Clove Road & Beverly Avenue, Staten Island, NY

1924

(2)

from Beverly Avenue.

728761f-b.text:
(1) 1179 Clove Road,at the N.E. corner of Beverly Avenue, showing the oldest Corson House, known as the slave
market. It was built in 1690.
About 1905
By Eugene G. Putnam
Courtesy of Staten Island Museum through P.L.5perr. (2) A view of the site after the house has been rased. Thhe row of houses fronts on Beverly Avenue.
May 4,i929
P.L.Sperr
(3)  Another view of the Corson House,looking northward
on Clove road.
Summer, 1924
P.L.Sperr
728761f-b.folder: Clove Road & Beverly Road, Staten Island, NY
